title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Loading tidyverse into r environment by using the code chunk below.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, psych)

text:

When I‚Äôm not pondering sci-fi lore (yes, Blade Runner fans, I see you üëÄ), you‚Äôll find me crafting solutions, learning new things, and enjoying the beauty of life‚Äôs simple joys. Oh, and breakfast for dinner? Not my thing‚Äîlet‚Äôs keep the pancakes in their morning glory, please! ü•ûüåÖ

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Loading tidyverse into r environment by using the code chunk below.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse, psych)

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Importing data
This is an outdated version. Use _ instead of . functions

realis_csv <- read.csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")

Code chunk below uses uses read_csv() of readr to import REALIS2019.csv into r environment as a tiblle data.frame.

realis2019 <- read_csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")


#! eval: FALSE
popdata_fat <- read_csv("data/PopData2019_fat.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Pivoting data

#! eval: FALSE
popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>%
  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
               names_to = "Age Group",
               values_to = "Population")


More pipes:

#popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>%
#  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
#               names_to = "Age Group",
#               values_to = "Population") %>%
#  select("Age Group" == "5_to_9")


# Filter the dataset for a specific Age Group, e.g., "0_to_4"
popdata_filtered <- popdata_long %>%
  filter(`Age Group` == "0_to_4")  # Replace "0_to_4" with your desired age group

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Save data
rds: r native file format - always good to save as rds format

#! eval: FALSE
write_rds(popdata_fat, "data/rds/popdata_fat.rds")
write_rds(popdata_long, "data/rds/popdata_long.rds")

because you stopped all the processes above with #! eval: FALSE - only display code, does not run the code you have to read the processed file again. #! echo: False: you run the code in the background, without displaying code

#! echo: False
popdata_long <- read_rds("data/rds/popdata_long.rds")  # Loading long-format population data

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Working with dplyr

Selecting columns

realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>%
  select(`Project Name`,
         `Transacted Price ($)`,
         `Property Type`,
         `Type of Sale`,
         `Unit Price ($ psm)`)



Filtering columns

realis2019_filtered <- realis2019_selected %>%
  filter(`Property Type` == "Condominium" |
           `Property Type` == "Apartment") %>%
  filter(`Type of Sale` == "Resale") %>%
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)



Combining selection and filter with pipe

realis2019_end <- realis2019 %>%
  select(`Project Name`,
         `Transacted Price ($)`,
         `Property Type`,
         `Type of Sale`,
         `Unit Price ($ psm)`) %>%
  filter(`Property Type` == "Condominium" |
           `Property Type` == "Apartment") %>%
  filter(`Type of Sale` == "Resale") %>%
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)
